item.title: Transcript of Netanyahu’s Remarks to Congress
item.description: The full text of Benjamin Netanyahu’s remarks on Iran to a joint meeting of Congress.

item.title: Itineraries: Etihad Airways’ Rapid Growth Frustrates Rivals
item.description: How Etihad runs and is financed are central in a fight with airlines in the United States, which accuse Persian Gulf carriers of stealing passengers.
item.dc:creator: By JAD MOUAWAD

item.title: Europe Unlikely to Meet Climate Goal, Study Finds
item.description: The European Union will most likely fail to meet an ambitious goal of reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 2050, a report has found.
item.dc:creator: By MELISSA EDDY
item.media:description: A coal-fired power station in Gelsenkirchen, Germany. Many energy providers there use brown coal, a cheap and dirty fossil fuel.

item.title: Cross Section of Democrats to Snub Netanyahu’s Speech to Congress
item.description: At least 49 House and Senate members said they would not attend the Israeli prime minister’s address, with some calling it a political stunt.
item.dc:creator: By JONATHAN WEISMAN

item.title: Obama and Netanyahu Play Down Rancor on Iran, but Views Still Differ Sharply
item.description: President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel offered divergent approaches to Iran but tried to cool down the personal nature of any dispute.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, appearing before an estimated 16,000 supporters of Israel, characterized the disagreement over Iran as a family fight.

item.title: Live Updates: Netanyahu Addresses Congress
item.description: Live video and analysis from New York Times reporters and editors.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

item.title: Netanyahu, in Speech to Congress, Calls Iran a Threat to Israel’s Survival
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel used one of the most prominent platforms in the world to warn against what he considers an ill-advised nuclear deal being negotiated with Iran.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel addressing a joint meeting of Congress on Tuesday.

item.title: Indian State Passes Beef Ban Championed by Right-Wing Hindus
item.description: Maharashtra has become the first Indian state to ban the possession and sale of beef, imposing penalties of up to five years in prison or a fine for violations.
item.dc:creator: By NEHA THIRANI BAGRI

item.title: Thousands Honor Boris Nemtsov, Putin Critic Killed in Russia
item.description: Diplomats, political allies and family members said their last goodbyes at the viewing and funeral of Boris Y. Nemtsov, who was fatally shot Friday in Moscow.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW E. KRAMER
item.media:description: Mourners followed the coffin of Boris Y. Nemtsov through the streets of Moscow.

item.title: Iraqi Forces Press Tikrit Offensive Against ISIS
item.description: Military officials said their forces were just south of Tikrit and advancing slowly after freeing 13 police officers held by Islamic State fighters.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD

item.title: In Tehran, Too, Netanyahu’s Speech Finds an Eager Audience
item.description: Many in Iran have been awaiting the address by the Israeli prime minister to Congress because they say they hope his blunt approach will turn American public opinion against him.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS ERDBRINK

item.title: South Korea, Seeking to Curb Graft, Passes Law Restricting Gifts
item.description: The law calls for up to three years in prison for journalists and teachers, as well as public servants, who accept single cash donations or gifts valued at more than a million won, or about $910.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Bus Driver in Delhi Gang Rape Blames Victim
item.description: In an interview, for a film that will air Sunday on the BBC, Mukesh Singh said the woman had provoked the deadly assault by resisting the rape.
item.dc:creator: By ELLEN BARRY

item.title: News Analysis: For Netanyahu and Obama, Difference Over Iran Widened Into Chasm
item.description: Over six years of disagreements about how to deal with the Iranian nuclear threat, the leaders never described their ultimate goal the same way.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID E. SANGER
item.media:description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel and President Obama at the White House in October.

item.title: European Banking Regulator Postpones Next Stress Tests to 2016
item.description: The European Banking Authority said lenders had strengthened their capital positions after reviews last year.
item.dc:creator: By CHAD BRAY

item.title: 20 Killed as Bus Falls Off Cliff in Central China
item.description: The vehicle was said to be carrying members of a traveling opera troupe, and 13 other people on board were injured.
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG

item.title: World Briefing: Australia to Send More Troops to Iraq as Trainers in ISIS Fight
item.description: Prime Minister Tony Abbott said that 300 more troops would be sent to train Iraqi forces, expanding Australia’s role in the fight against the Islamic State.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MICHELLE INNIS

item.title: Figures From U.S.-Led Coalition Show Heavy 2014 Losses for Afghan Army
item.description: The 20,000 fighters and others lost last year cast further doubt on Afghanistan’s ability to maintain security without help from United States-led coalition forces.
item.dc:creator: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and AZAM AHMED

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China Overtakes U.S. at the Box Office
item.description: Riding on a slate of domestic films in the Lunar New Year holiday season, China’s monthly box office receipts in February surpassed those of the United States for the first time.
item.dc:creator: By AMY QIN

item.title: Toronto Police Say Tunnel Mystery Is Solved
item.description: The site near where the Pan Am Games will be held raised suspicions, but officials say that two men simply dug a hole with plans to hang out there.
item.dc:creator: By IAN AUSTEN
